name: Flareon

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Flareon in order to use this attack.

flavorText: When storing thermal energy in its body, its temperature could soar to over 1600 degrees.

strengths: Quick Attack can be powered by Double Colorless Energy
Fire type is strong against Grass Pokemon
weaknesses: 70 HP is fragile for a 4-energy attacker
Water weakness is problematic against Rain Dance decks
4 energy cost is slow to setup
synergies: Double Colorless Energy - helps power up attacks
Energy Retrieval - recover discarded Fire energy
Eevee - required for evolution, provides deck flexibility
Pokemon Breeder - skip Eevee with Base Set Flareon (if available)
counters: Blastoise Rain Dance - Water weakness and fast energy acceleration
Any Water Pokemon - double damage from weakness

competitiveHistory: Flareon from Jungle saw limited competitive play. While Flamethrower's 60 damage was respectable, the 4 energy cost and required energy discard made it less efficient than other Fire options like Arcanine. The Water weakness was particularly problematic in a meta where Blastoise Rain Dance was dominant. Flareon was primarily used in casual Eeveelution-themed decks rather than top-tier competitive builds.

rulings.ruling: You must discard a Fire Energy card to use Flamethrower. If you cannot discard a Fire Energy, you cannot use the attack.
Quick Attack's coin flip determines the damage before applying Weakness and Resistance.
